did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: New York Wine & Grape Foundation records, 1968-2004.
did.physdesc: Correspondence, Financial records, Photographs, Printed material, Publications
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Records documenting the work of the Mew York Wine and Grape Foundation.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: New York Wine & Grape Foundation (NYWGF) is a not-for-profit trade association of the New York wine and grape industries that is charged with promoting the products of the New York grape growing and wine producing industries and funding research relevant to these industries.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Records documenting the work of the Foundation including promotion, legislative work, funded research, and trade shows and conferences. Includes information on area wineries and the Uncork New York! campaign. Many items showing the involvements of President Jim Tresize. Also papers regarding other groups such as the New York State Wine Grape Growers and The New York Wine Council.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Grape industry -- New York (State)
Wine and wine making -- New York (State)
Wine -- Marketing.
Liquor laws.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: New York Wine & Grape Foundation. Records, #6707. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See also collection #6695 Box 4 for oversize items including advertising proofs for NYWGF ad campaigns.

A brief history of the New York Wine & Grape Foundation was published in Wine East volume 22 number 3, September - October 1994, under the title "How a Foundation Helped Uncork New York" by Hudson Cattell. A copy is available in the accession folder.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Forms part of the Eastern Wine and Grape Archive. (EWGA)

scopecontent.p: The New York Agricultural Statistics Service was the result of a cooperative agreement between the NYS Department of Agriculture and Markets and the National Agricultural Statistics Service of USDA to provide details about current trends in agriculture.
Special reports of temperature and precipitation throughout New York state.

separatedmaterial.head: SEPARATED MATERIAL
separatedmaterial.p: Copies of the Living Section from the New York Times from 1990 have been removed, these are available online. They likely were saved because that is where the column Wine Talk by Frank J Prial is found.
